basics.name: Vicente Robles, PhD
basics.title: Scientist & Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced engineer with expertise in design, data analysis, modeling, and prototyping.

work.name: MetroLaser Inc.
summary:
• Developing a non-intrusive health monitoring system for elemental detection in rocket flows using laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy, with funding by the Department of Defense (DOD)
• Engineered and fabricated a high-pressure aerosol generator for laboratory testing of the monitoring system, utilizing SolidWorks CAD for design and machining in construction
• Ensured compliance with company rules, safety protocols, and EHS guidelines in a clean optical lab, reducing contaminants on optics while meeting deadlines, preparing technical documentation, and submitting reports to funding agencies

work.name: Exponent
summary:
• Performed optical safety analysis for consumer electronics (with LEDs/lasers) including prototype evaluations via Zemax simulations, and experimental measurements according to IEC standards
• Collaborated with cross-disciplinary engineers on electrical and mechanical projects, employing engineering methods to characterize and test materials, including failure mode analysis

work.name: UC Riverside
summary:
• Managed research initiatives centered on laser-induced cavitation fluid dynamics with emphasis on microfluidic agitation and material perforation for a needle-free proof of concept
• Designed and implemented complex optical configurations, incorporating both continuous wave and high-energy pulsed lasers
• Integrated advanced techniques including laser surface texturing, high-speed imaging, fluorescence thermometry, and particle image velocimetry to non-intrusively characterize cavitation events
• Published 6 research papers, actively mentored 2 undergraduates, and secured a research grant

work.name: SpaceX
summary:
• Utilized SolidWorks to design and construct a high pressurization system to safely validate and extend the NASA TM X-53692 Standard for leak detection in aerospace subsystems
• Developed a testing method and protocol to conducted leak classifications using alternate tracer gasses (dry air, and hydrogen-nitrogen mixture) to compare against the industry standard of helium

awards.summary: Ford Foundation Fellowships support diverse individuals with superior academic achievement. Aimed at those committed to research, the program seeks scholars who demonstrate promise for future achievement.
